title: [BUG] Can't train via CLI command `mlflow run .`.  No such file or directory.

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

- Client: 2.0.1
- Tracking server: 2.0.1


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution**: Ubuntu 20.04
- **Python version**: Python 3.8.10


### Describe the problem

I just recently updated to MLflow version 2.0.1. I tried to run my training as usual running `mlflow run . --experiment-name "Name" ...` using a MLproject with a Docker environment. Sadly it returns:

```bash
python3: can't open file 'scripts/run_experiment.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```

This didn't happen in the previous version of MLflow and I tried downgrading the version and it runs smoothly. Seems like my docker container does not have my training scripts and so the training can't be executed.

Maybe I missed some changes in the MLproject and CLI commands and now I should link the volume to my docker container.

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

My file structure is:

```
root_directory
      |---scripts
      |         |--files.py
      |         |--
      |
      |---MLproject
```

To reproduce the issue just try to run something using the run command. I tried two types of trainings and both failed.

```bash
mlflow run . --experiment-name "Experiment name" \
    -P ... \
    -P ... \
    -A gpus=all \
    -A network=host

### Stack trace

Some parts of the stack trace are indicated as `[a bunch of commands]` for privacy purpose

```bash
2022/12/15 10:49:57 INFO mlflow.projects.docker: registry.cinfo.es/ai-mlflow-experiments/mlflow-darknet-experiment/experiment:latest already exists
2022/12/15 10:49:57 INFO mlflow.projects.utils: === Created directory /tmp/tmpezlbdz06 for downloading remote URIs passed to arguments of type 'path' ===
2022/12/15 10:49:57 INFO mlflow.projects.backend.local: === Running command 'docker run --rm --gpus all --network host --tty -e [a bunch of commands] registry.cinfo.es/ai-mlflow-experiments/mlflow-darknet-experiment/experiment:latest python3 scripts/run_experiment.py [a bunch of commands(again)] in run with ID '819450cd379e4b1c9992ad62b112a229' === 
python3: can't open file 'scripts/run_experiment.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```

### Other info / logs

_No response_

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [X] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
